title: George Calombaris is spotted waiting tables at his restaurant Hellenic Republic
text:
With his MasterChef gig now over, George Calombaris seemingly has a lot more time to spend at his Melbourne restaurants.

The 41-year-old chef was spotted carrying plates of food out from the kitchen at his Brighton restaurant, Hellenic Republic on Friday.

Dressed in a navy blue apron bearing the Greek restaurant's logo, George carried what appeared to have been a chocolate dessert.

Hard at work: With his MasterChef gig now over, George Calombaris (pictured) seemingly has a lot more time to spend at his Melbourne restaurants, spotted at Hellenic Republic on Friday

He also wore ripped grey jeans, a white chef shirt and a pair of gold sneakers, while a pen was propped behind his right ear.

Despite months of bad publicity, George appeared to have been in high spirits, enjoying a laugh with a table of patrons.

At one stage, the former MasterChef judge was seen frowning animatedly from inside the popular restaurant.

Mixing with the people: Despite months of bad publicity, George appeared to have been in high spirits, enjoying a laugh with a table of patrons

George is reportedly being forced to sell his $4.75 million mansion in Melbourne's Toorak, according to a report by Woman's Day on Monday.

It comes after the celebrity chef admitted to underpaying staff at his Melbourne restaurants nearly $8 million.

'The pay scandal has cost George and his family enormously, not only in a dollar sense but reputationally, too. It's all come crashing down on him,' a source told the magazine.

Support: In an interview with the Herald Sun on Tuesday, fellow chef Curtis Stone (second left) said it was 'absolutely' time for the Australian public to forgive George. Pictured alongside former MasterChef judges Gary Mehigan (far left) and Matt Preston (far right)

But many of George's friends in the industry have rallied around the chef in the wake of the scandal.

In an interview with the Herald Sun on Tuesday, fellow chef Curtis Stone said it was 'absolutely' time for the Australian public to forgive George.

'I just had dinner [at Hellenic Republic in Brighton] while I was in Melbourne last week and it's so good, I'm trying to convince him to come to LA and open one there,' the 43-year-old said.
description: With his MasterChef gig now over, George Calombaris seemingly has a lot more time to spend at his Melbourne restaurants.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
